name: Bangkok Riverfront
description: Bangkoks business district extends right over the Chao Phraya river—never-stop lights shining on the mix of skyscrapers, solemn temples, and local ferries. Bangkoks riverfront is packed with high-end hotels, parks full of greenery and water lily ponds, plus splendid views of Wat Arun and mega-suspension bridges across the water.

name: Manali
description: Besides natural charm and unparalleled beauty, Manali is known for its unlimited adventure opportunities, the famous Hadimba Temple, the scenic Rohtang Pass, the snow-laden Solang Valley and its delightful culinary scene.

name: Similan Islands
description: Similan Islands are small group islands in the Andaman Sea which are regarded as charming islands on both land and underwater. There are many beautiful coral reefs and unique fish such as whales, dolphins, Moray eels that can be seen while diving in either deep or shallow sea.

name: Colosseum
description: The Colosseum was absolutely breathtaking. The views from both outside and inside were fantastic and the €12 entry was well worth it. We bought tickets when we arrived and were served served away. We also queued at the entrance for less than 5 minutes before being admitted.

name: Doi Inthanon
description: Doi Inthanon National Park is perhaps the most underrated place to visit in Chiang Mai. Located on the highest mountain in Thailand, hiking up the trail to reach Doi Inthanon summit is beautiful. The King and Queen Pagodas overlooking the mountain is utterly, unexpectedly, breathtakingly beautiful!

name: Louvre Museum
description: The Louvre is the worlds largest museum and houses one of the most impressive art collections in history. The magnificent, baroque-style palace and museum — LeMusée du Louvre in French — sits along the banks of the Seine River in Paris. It is one of the citys biggest tourist attractions.
